titleStmt.title: Annotations for 王羲之集二卷

publicationStmt.p: published electronically as part of the TLS project at https://hxwd.org

sourceDesc.p: Created by members of the TLS project

sense.def: Foucault: soin de soi> take good care of oneself; Take good care of yourself 保重！
happen at the time N; be cone at the time N
the 50th year in a hexagesimal cycle
during Han and Qin times: low-level local guest house below the level of the xiàn 縣
命也“it is because of fate": be because of N; be because of the reason N; depend on N
men of dignified talent and worth; worthies
all; completely; exhaustively; all one after the other
arrive on the scene; turn up; move in to take action; come to join
high and impressive, imposing (of mountains or buildings)
mountain of rock; mountain (occasionally not of rock, and even man-made)
high, outstanding and dangerous (as of mountains)
mountain 五嶺 refers to a place characterised by five interleinkted mountain peaks
gyrate, whirl; gush forth, gush out
seduce the contextually determinate N to V
make the contextually determinate N1 into N2
drinking game when cups with alcohol float on running water
cause to float along (one's glance etc)
beaker or bowl filled with wine: a beaker of any kind filled with wine
其人"the right person": the right N; the right kind of N, the appropriate, the relevant, the suitable
even if, contrary to conceivable fact
at one time... at another time
intone poetry without using a definite tune, sing about something without a definite tune but with long-drawn-out intonation
still surely; nonetheless surely; still likewise
as far as N is concerned, it works like this: S
bending back (so as to look upwards), looking upwards
contemplate and reflect on; critically observe, watch carefully; look over carefully and systematically, make an overall investigation; survey and examine
the universe of space and time (according to HNZ "the (cosmic) eaves and rafters" 高誘 注："宇，屋簷也；宙，棟梁也。")

老之將至 "the coming arrival of old age" nominaliser converting a sentence with a verbal predicate into an abstract nominalisation (sometimes best rendered in English not with a nominalisation but a that-clause when in object position)
look closely into, pay close attention to and investigate
the subjective reason for the explicit or implicit subject doing V
give free rein to one's feelings
reach to the extremes of, reach throughout; exercise to the utmost; put every effort into
In fact... (opening a whole chapter in a non-narrative mode)

it from the source N [The important question is whether when Confucius says 聞諸老子曰 this naturally implies that he has heard from Laozi, or whether the natural meaning is that he has has heard (somewhere) that Laozi said".
just one single; one single entity; only one single; one and only; only one, just one; no more than one; one alone; one single; a single
make oneself depend on; place oneself as dependent on (ZUO); rely for (legs) (on a horse)
behave without restrain at a place N
outside of N, outside the place N
even if, contrary to conceivable fact
at the time of S1 happening S2 happened
(in subordinate sentences) he, she, it, they
direct object: 所樂 "what (the understood/contextually determinate subject) enjoys": that which (the understood subject) Vt-s； the object Vt-ed by the the understood subject
run into; meet by chance (desirable objects); come upon; come across
for a brief moment 暫來 蹔來
find the contextually determinate N1 in N2
even; curiously enough even (typically with negatives)

忘身之老 "forget that one is old": nominaliser converting a sentence with a verbal predicate into an abstract nominalisation (sometimes best rendered in English not with a nominalisation but a that-clause when in object position)
be about to; will in the future; be going to
when it came to the point that S, by the time that S, at the point when S
